sentences.sContent: There is a real danger that the disease might spread.
sentences.sCn: 这种疾病确实有蔓延的危险。

sentences.sContent: We need to tackle the real problems of unemployment and poverty.
sentences.sCn: 我们需要解决失业和贫穷这两个实际问题。

sentences.sContent: There is no real reason to worry.
sentences.sCn: 没有什么真正的理由需要担心。

sentences.sContent: ...Another issue affecting real estate in the coming year will be America’s failing infrastructure...
...The Urbanization — migration away from the suburbs to the city center — will be the biggest real estate trend in 2015...
...Another reason why teachers should maintain a formal students with their students is to avoid real and perceived bias...
...maintaining a formal distance between teachers and students can ensure an atmosphere of authority in the classroom and avoid both real and perceived bias...
...a real innovative company should develop an innovation culture and use it as a primary tool for success...
...A reasonable assumption—don’t families struggle to avoid nursing homes and suffer real guilt if they can’t...
...But an accumulating body of research indicates that some distinctions between one type of elder care and another have little real bearing on how well residents do...
...Relationships in the real world are maintained through human contact and spending time with each other instead of chitchatting online...
...organic ingredients; all you need is real food...
...At the shops where you spend any real money...

房地产管理；物业管理；不动产管理

trans.tranOther: something that is real exists and is important
